value.title: Using Images from a Database in Power BI
value.excerpt: We've looked at images from sources like OneDrive and the web with your Power BI reports. What about from a database? Is that possible? Patrick takes a look at how you can do it.  SQLJason Blog:  http://sqljason.com/2018/01/embedding-images-in-power-bi-using-base64.html  Gerhard's Blog: https://blog.gbrueckl.at/2018/01/storing-images-powerbi-analysis-services-data-models/

value.title: Using R Visuals with Power BI
value.excerpt: You can take advantage of the R Script showcase to start using R Visuals with your reports. These provide great examples of what your R Script should look like to interact with data and you can compare how your visual looks to the example.   R Script Showcase - http://community.powerbi.com/t5/R-Script-Showcase/bd-p/RVisuals

value.title: What is a Power BI tenant? (Office 365 / Azure Active Directory)
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at what a Power BI tenant is. This is really the Azure Active Directory / Office 365 tenant that contains your users, groups, subscriptions and more.   LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: What the HECK is a Power BI Gateway Cluster?
value.excerpt: Confused about what a Power BI Gateway cluster is? Have your On-Premises Data Gateway installed but it's overloaded? This video is for you!  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/data-integration/gateway/service-gateway-high-availability-clusters  PowerShell: https://docs.microsoft.com/data-integration/gateway/service-gateway-powershell-support

value.title: When is a date not a date in Power BI?
value.excerpt: When is a date not a date? We all use them in our data. Patrick looks at how data types can be a tricky thing in Power BI. value.title: Working with images in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows you how to work with images in Power BI. He isn't talking about adding a logo into your report. This looks at how you can integrate visuals in your visuals based on your data.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Working with Slowly Changing Dimensions in Power BI

value.title: Advanced Power BI Bookmark Options (Data/Display/Current Page)
value.excerpt: If you use Power BI Bookmarks you may not have used the advanced bookmarking options for  ➔ Bookmark Data ➔ Bookmark Display  ➔ Bookmark Current Page I talk about these options and show you were these can really help you out when using Power BI Bookmarks in advanced scenarios.  ================================

value.title: How to Show Items with No Data in Power BI (e.g. Show All Month Names)
value.excerpt: Sometimes the default behavior in Power BI can be frustrating. For example, if you are showing month names, you may see that if no data is available then those months may not be shown in your Chart or Table. Often, you would want all months (Jan-Dec) to be shown, regardless of whether data is present

value.title: Power BI Apps and App Workspaces: How to distribute Power BI content to a Large Audience
value.excerpt: Power BI Apps are a terrific way to distribute your Power BI content to a large audience.  You can "Publish App" to Entire Organization or specific individuals and groups. Then any user (within the Group you provided Access to) can click "Get Apps" to consume your App - which comprises the Dashboards,

value.title: Age Calculation in Power BI using Power Query
value.excerpt: Power Query has a simple way of calculating the age. However, because DAX is the popular language in many calculations in Power BI, many are not aware of this function in Power Query. In this video, I am going to show you how easy is to calculate Age in Power BI using Power BI. This method is very useful

value.title: Previous Dynamic Period using DAX in Power BI
value.excerpt: Parallel Period is a function that helps you fetching the previous period of a Month, Quarter, or Year. value.title: Showing Ranking in a Visual in Power BI using RANKX DAX function
value.excerpt: If you want to show the ranking in a Power BI visual, one way is to use a visual that supports that, such as a Ribbon chart. Another way, which is a more common way, is to write a calculation for rank, and RANKX is a DAX function that can help you with that. In this article and video, I explain how that
